item.title: Dragon Age: The Veilguard Drops to Just $49.99 on Xbox for Cyber Monday
item.content:encoded:
https://www.ign.com/articles/dragon-age-the-veilguard-cyber-monday-deal-2024

Save $20 for a limited time.

Dragon Age: The Veilguard is down to just $49.99 in the Cyber Monday sales, or $69.99 for the Deluxe Edition. It's just for Xbox players, but at $20 off, it's still a wonderful offer and one of the best Xbox Cyber Monday deals right now. The action RPG is also down to $62.99 for those on PS5, which is a minor discount in comparison, but still worth mentioning in case you still want to pick up the game.

Dragon Age: The Veilguard

In their 9/10 review of the game, Leana Hafer said: "Dragon Age: The Veilguard refreshes and reinvigorates a storied series that stumbled through its middle years, and leaves no doubt that it deserves its place in the RPG pantheon. The next Mass Effect is going to have a very tough act to follow, which is not something I ever imagined I'd be saying before I got swept away on this adventure."

"Enjoyable action combat, a fantastic cast of allies with sweeping story arcs all their own, top-notch cinematics, and moving, nuanced character writing are the wings on which this triumphant dragon soars, pulling out all the stops in a whirlwind tour of Northern Thedas and capping it with a terrific finale that’s built on memorably tough choices and consequences. If we never get another Dragon Age, at least it got to go out on a high note."

More Xbox Cyber Monday Deals

Cyber Monday has unleashed some of the best Xbox video game deals, offering massive savings on fan favorites and fresh releases. Another standout alongside Dragon Age? Dragon Ball: Sparking! Zero for just under $50 as well.

We’ve curated the top picks to make your shopping easier, but if you’re up for a treasure hunt, head over to Amazon and explore their sprawling lineup of Xbox deals. From blockbusters to hidden gems, there’s something for every gamer waiting to be scooped up.

What is Cyber Monday?

Traditionally, Black Friday was the in-store shopping frenzy, while Cyber Monday focused on online deals. While those lines have blurred, Cyber Monday remains the top event for online-focused retailers like Amazon, Newegg, Dell, HP, and Lenovo. Even traditional retailers like Best Buy, Target, and Walmart roll out exclusive online-only offers. Switch and PS5 deals are also now live.

Many of the same deals from Black Friday normally return for Cyber Monday 2024, including some that sold out or expired. Retailers often stagger their inventory, reserving stock for each major sale event. This means Cyber Monday will bring back popular deals alongside brand-new, never-before-seen offers. But, most importantly, Cyber Monday is the final day of the Black Friday, November, sale season, with all the deals going with it.

Robert Anderson is a deals expert and Commerce Editor for IGN. You can follow him @robertliam21 on Twitter.

item.title: Last Chance Cyber Monday Deals On Japanese Pokémon TCG Booster Boxes
item.content:encoded:
https://www.ign.com/articles/pokemon-tcg-booster-boxes-japanese-cyber-monday-deals-2024

Cyber Monday prices for guaranteed pulls

Japanese Pokémon cards can be a rarity in the West, especially for Cyber Monday where sales are usually focused on English Pokémon TCG cards. Walmart's Cyber Monday sale has trainers covered, with deals on some of the best Scarlet and Violet era booster boxes. That includes 151, Paradise Dragona and Electric Breaker. Let's get into it:

Save on rare Japanese Pokémon Trading Card Game booster boxes this Cyber Monday. Deals include the Scarlet & Violet 151 Booster Box for $99.99 (save $106), Paradise Dragona Booster Box for $42.29 (save $5.23), and the Super Electric Breaker Booster Box for $45.99 (save $12.01) as of Dec. 2.

Scarlet & Violet Enhanced Expansion Pack Pokemon Card 151" Box (Japanese)

Pokemon Card Game Scarlet & Violet Enhanced Expansion Pack Pokemon Card 151" Box (Japanese)

The Scarlet & Violet 151 set is a nostalgic goldmine, uniting all 151 original Kanto Pokémon in a single collection. It's the first set to feature Kadabra in over two decades. Thanks, Uri Geller for thinking everything is about you for around three decades.

With 165 cards and 45 secret rares, including the stunning Mew SAR, this box offers a rare opportunity to own a piece of Pokémon history. Each Master Ball mirror variant card is a massive pull too, with only one item included per box. At least you know it's coming!

Paradise Dragona Booster Box (Japanese, 30 Booster Packs)

Pokémon TCG: Paradise Dragona Booster Box (Japanese, 30 Booster Packs)

Released in September 2024, this tropical-themed set is a dragon trainers dream. It boasts 64 base cards and 30 secret rares and introduces powerful new mechanics like Stellar-type Tera Pokémon ex.

Chase cards like Lisia's Appeal and Alolan Exeggutor ex SAR make this set stand out for any trainer or collector. With vibrant artwork and strong gameplay potential, there's some essential cards in this expansion.

Scarlet & Violet Super Electric Breaker Booster Box (Japanese)

Pokémon Card Game Scarlet & Violet Super Electric Breaker Booster Box (Japanese)

Launched in October 2024, this electric-themed set packs a serious punch. Terastal Pikachu ex SAR takes center stage alongside 106 cards and 32 secret rares.

The Blueberry Academy vibe and electrifying Special Art Rares like Milotic Ex make this set a thrilling choice for any trainer looking to add a spark or six to their deck or collection.

Cyber Monday is here, and it's bringing some of the hottest Nintendo Switch deals we've seen this year. While the epic Black Friday bundle—featuring up to $155 off—has vanished into the holiday shopping void, there’s still a chance it could make a surprise comeback today. If you missed out, don’t give up just yet.

Right now, digital editions of Tears of the Kingdom are just $30 at Walmart, marking one of the lowest prices ever for this hit game. Whether you're looking for discounts on consoles, games, or accessories, there are plenty of incredible deals to grab. Check out our top picks below, and keep an eye out for more updates as the day goes on.

TL;DR - These Are the Best Nintendo Switch Cyber Monday Deals

  • Switch Micro SD Card 1TB - $54.99
  • Tears of the Kingdom (Digital Edition) - $30
  • Sonic X Shadow Generations - $29.99
  • Metal Gear Solid: The Master Collection Vol. 1 - $18.74
  • Switch Ring Fit Adventure - $49.99
  • TOTK: Official Guide: Collector's Edition - $22.49
  • Anker 737 140W 24K - $79.99

Switch Cyber Monday Game Deals

The final phase of Nintendo’s Cyber Monday sale has officially begun, offering some of the best deals we’ve seen all season. If you’ve been holding out for incredible discounts, now’s the time to act—these prices aren’t likely to drop any further.

There are plenty of standout deals, especially for Switch games under $30, making it a fantastic opportunity to expand your collection. Highlights include Sonic X Generations for $29.99, Metal Gear Solid for $18.74, and Balatro for just $19.99. Whether you're shopping for yourself or looking for gifts, these offers won’t last long—so make sure to grab them before they’re gone after today.

Switch MicroSD Card Cyber Monday Deals

Cyber Monday is the perfect time to level up your Switch experience, especially when it comes to storage. The Nintendo Switch and Switch OLED come with 32GB and 64GB of internal storage, respectively—though a chunk of that is reserved for the system.

To put things into perspective, Tears of the Kingdom eats up about 16GB, and Breath of the Wild takes up roughly 13.5GB. That means if you’re planning to download both games, you’ll be pretty close to filling up the original Switch’s storage. That’s where a high-capacity memory card comes in, and trust us, it’s no longer just a luxury—it’s a must-have.

The good news? Some of our top recommended SD cards for the Switch are part of the Cyber Monday deals, making it the ideal time to grab one at a great price. It’s a small investment that can save you from constant storage headaches, leaving you free to download and play as many games as you want without worrying about space.

Best Switch Power Bank Deals

Anker 737 PowerCore 24K 24,000mAh Power Bank with 140W USB Type-C Power Delivery

INIU 20,000mAh 22.5W Power Bank

Amazon's Cyber Monday sale is bringing one of the best deals yet, with the Anker 737 24,000mAh 140W Power Bank available for just $73.99! This offer combines a massive 50% discount with an extra $6 off when you clip the voucher on Amazon.

This is the lowest price we've seen for this powerhouse of a portable charger, and it’s an absolute must-have for anyone who owns a Nintendo Switch, Steam Deck, or Asus ROG Ally. As a long-time owner of the Anker 737, I can vouch for its reliability—it's been my go-to companion for over a year, keeping my ROG Ally and multiple Switch consoles charged during countless flights and road trips. Despite heavy use, it still performs like new, making it a smart investment for anyone who needs reliable power on the go.

Tears of the Kingdom: Official Guide for $22.49

The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom – The Complete Official Guide: Collector's Edition

Still making your way through The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom? With its sprawling world and countless secrets, you’re not alone. Fortunately, both the Collector’s Edition Official Guide is here to help—and they’re now discounted by up to 40% for Cyber Monday.

These guides offer a comprehensive tour of Hyrule, detailed walkthroughs to tackle every challenge, and a wealth of extras to enhance your journey. Plus, they look stunning on a shelf, with the Collector’s Edition sporting an especially eye-catching cover.

Out of Stock: Nintendo Switch Joy-Con and Controller Deals

Joy-Con Wireless Controllers for Nintendo Switch - Neon Red/Neon Blue

Currently sold out at Amazon :(

Nintendo Switch Pro Controller

It's worth noting that some of the best Nintendo Switch controller deals are already out of stock for Cyber Monday. Both the Switch Pro Controller and Joy-Con controllers have been incredibly popular, with limited quantities flying off the shelves.

Whether you’re looking to upgrade your gaming setup with the ergonomic Switch Pro Controller or need a backup pair of Joy-Con for local multiplayer fun, these highly sought-after items have been snapped up quickly. If you missed out, don’t worry—keep an eye on restocks throughout the day, as these controllers often make a comeback during high-traffic sales events.

Out of Stock: Switch Black Friday Console Deals

Switch OLED: Mario Kart 8 Deluxe Bundle

Select shipping and then add to cart.

Switch: Mario Kart 8 Deluxe Bundle

Select shipping and then add to cart.

The Nintendo Switch Black Friday bundle was one of the hottest deals of the season, but unfortunately, it's now sold out. This limited-time bundle featured $155 in savings on the OLED or standard console alongside Mario Kart 8 and 12-months of NSO, and was unsurprisingly very popular.

Whether you were hoping to score a Switch for Christmas or grab it with a set of accessories, this deal was a fan favorite. If you missed out, don’t lose hope—there’s still a chance it could be restocked during Cyber Monday, so be sure to check back for any last-minute opportunities.

Free In-Store Upcoming Switch Events

Nintendo is also organizing in-person demo events at Target, Best Buy, and GameStop, giving players a chance to try upcoming games and participate in giveaways.

  • Dec. 7: Best Buy Family Fun Day will offer hands-on demos for games like Mario & Luigi: Brothership, The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom, Super Mario Party Jamboree, Mario Kart 8 Deluxe, and Just Dance 2025.
  • Dec. 14: GameStop will host demos for the same lineup.

What About Switch 2? The Current State of the Nintendo Switch

Nintendo recently shared updates on its current Switch hardware and software sales, revealing a revised sales forecast for the fiscal year ending March 2025. The company is now projecting 12.5 million units sold, down from the previous estimate of 13.5 million. This comes as Nintendo reported a 17% drop in revenue and a 69% profit decline compared to the same quarter last year. For the six months ending September 30, Nintendo sold 4.72 million Switch units, down from 6.84 million in the previous year.

On the software side, The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom has sold 2.58 million copies, Mario Kart 8 Deluxe saw a 2.31 million increase, Paper Mario: The Thousand-Year Door reached 1.94 million, and Luigi's Mansion 2 HD sold 1.57 million copies during the April to September 2024 period.

In other news, Nintendo confirmed that the upcoming Switch 2 will be backward-compatible with original Switch games and will support Nintendo Switch Online. Nintendo president Shuntaro Furukawa revealed this at the company’s Corporate Management Policy Briefing, though further details about the successor's full features are expected after its official announcement, which is slated for before March 2025.
